statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Jermaine Mallett scored 22 points and Missouri State pulled away in the second half to beat Illinois State 82-71 Saturday night.
article.headline: Anthony Cousin's 23 not enough as Illinois State loses
article.linkText: Cousin's 23 not enough as Illinois State loses
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mo. -- Jermaine Mallett scored 22 points and Missouri State pulled away in the second half to beat Illinois State 82-71 Saturday night. Adam Leonard and Will Creekmore each added 16 points the Bears (10-3, 2-0 Missouri Valley), who shot 63 percent after halftime. Kyle Weems finished with 13 points. Anthony Cousin led the Redbirds (8-5, 0-2) with 23 points, Jackie Carmichael had 22 -- both career highs -- and John Wilkins 14. After taking a 38-36 leading into halftime, Missouri State opened the second half with a 15-7 run to push its lead to 10. Nafis Ricks scored six of his seven points during the spurt, and the Bears led by at least eight the rest of the way. Illinois State shot 68.2 percent (15 of 22) in the first half but never led my more than five and held its last lead at 13-10. The Redbirds shot 44.8 percent in the second half.
